newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Pilots from five airlines to discuss cooperation.
newsitem.headline: Pilots from five airlines to discuss cooperation.

text.p: Representatives of more than 12,000 pilots from Delta Air Lines, Swissair, Sabena, Austrian Airlines and Finnair met for the first time this weekend in Zurich to discuss ways to strengthen their cooperation.
Aeropers, the pilots association for Swissair, a unit of SAirGroup , said closer international cooperation was aimed at preventing airlines from pitting pilots against each other.
The growing trend toward international alliances, poses the threat that airlines can circumvene existing working agreements and transfer jobs, the association said in a statement.
To counter such problems, the pilots agreed to tighten their cooperation, exchange information and meet every three months.
Delta, Swissair, Sabena and Austrian Airlines cooperate in the Global Excellence alliance, while Swissair has a code-sharing agreement with Finnair.
